|accessdate=26 August 2011}}</ref> [[VVV-Venlo]]<ref>{{cite web |url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/news/story?id=678051&sec=europe |title=Eredivisie: Suarez bags four as Ajax thrash VVV |publisher=ESPN Soccernet |date=20 September 2009 |accessdate=13 April 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.ajax.nl/News/Archive/Article/Suarez-strikes-at-the-right-time.htm |title=Suarez strikes at the right time |work=Ajax.nl |publisher=AFC Ajax |date=20 September 2009 |accessdate=25 August 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120407013116/http://english.ajax.nl/News/Archive/Article/Suarez-strikes-at-the-right-time.htm |archivedate=7 April 2012 |df= }}</ref> and [[Roda JC Kerkrade|Roda JC]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.ajax.nl/News/Archive/Article/Suarez-lifts-Ajax-over-Roda.htm |title=Suarez lifts Ajax over Roda |work=Ajax.nl |publisher=AFC Ajax |date=4 February 2010 |accessdate=25 August 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120407013133/http://english.ajax.nl/News/Archive/Article/Suarez-lifts-Ajax-over-Roda.htm |archivedate=7 April 2012 |df= }}</ref> He scored three in the first half in another win over VVV-Venlo<ref>{{cite news |url= http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report/_/id/271804 |title= Report: Ajax Amsterdam v VVV Venlo |publisher= ESPN Soccernet |date= 11 April 2010 |accessdate=26 August 2011}}</ref> and six against [[WHC Wezep]] in the [[KNVB Cup]] as Ajax won by a club-record margin of 14–1.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.ajax.nl/News/Archive/Article/Ajax-reaches-Cup-quarterfinal-with-record-win.htm |title=Ajax reaches Cup quarterfinal with record win |work=Ajax.nl |publisher=AFC Ajax |date=23 December 2009 |accessdate=25 August 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120407012725/http://english.ajax.nl/News/Archive/Article/Ajax-reaches-Cup-quarterfinal-with-record-win.htm |archivedate=7 April 2012 |df= }}</ref>
Suárez scored two goals in the [[Two-legged tie|second leg]] of the KNVB Cup final and finished as the tournament's top scorer.<ref name="Ajax wins Cup">{{cite web|url=http://english.ajax.nl/News/Archive/Article/Ajax-wins-Cup.htm |title=Ajax wins Cup |work=Ajax.nl |publisher=AFC Ajax |date=6 May 2010 |accessdate=27 August 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120407013139/http://english.ajax.nl/News/Archive/Article/Ajax-wins-Cup.htm |archivedate=7 April 2012 |df= }}</ref> Ajax won the Cup final 6–1 on [[Aggregate score#Total points series (aggregate)|aggregate]] over [[Feyenoord]],<ref name="Liverpool profile"/><ref name="Ajax wins Cup"/><ref name="Echo 2-3">{{cite news |url= http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/everton-fc/everton-fc-news/2011/02/10/the-luis-suarez-story-part-two-new-liverpool-fc-star-always-one-to-hit-the-headlines-100252-28146234/3/ |title=The Luis Suarez story part two – new Liverpool FC star always one to hit the headlines |work=Liverpool Echo|publisher=Trinity Mirror |date=10 February 2011 |accessdate=23 August 2011 |page=3 }}</ref> but they finished second in the league behind [[FC Twente|Twente]].<ref name="Echo 2-2">{{cite news |url= http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/everton-fc/everton-fc-news/2011/02/10/the-luis-suarez-story-part-two-new-liverpool-fc-star-always-one-to-hit-the-headlines-100252-28146234/2/ |title=The Luis Suarez story part two – new Liverpool FC star always one to hit the headlines |work=Liverpool Echo|publisher=Trinity Mirror |date=10 February 2011 |accessdate=22 August 2011 |page=2 }}</ref>
Suárez ended the season as the Eredivisie's top scorer with 35 goals in 33 matches<ref name="Soccernet Ajax-Liv transfer"/><ref name="Echo 2-2"/> and had 49 goals in all competitions.<ref name="Echo 2-2"/> He was named Ajax Player of the Year for the second straight year<ref name="Liverpool profile"/> and [[Dutch Footballer of the Year]].<ref name="Liverpool profile"/><ref name="Echo 2-2"/><ref>{{cite web|first=Johannes |last=Baas |url=http://www.elsevier.nl/web/Nieuws/Sport/264665/Luis-Suarez-beste-eredivisievoetballer-van-het-jaar.htm |title=Luis Suarez beste eredivisievoetballer van het jaar |publisher=Elsevier |date=3 May 2010 |accessdate=3 May 2010 |language=Dutch |trans-title=Luis Suarez Eredivisie player of the year |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110724152720/http://www.elsevier.nl/web/Nieuws/Sport/264665/Luis-Suarez-beste-eredivisievoetballer-van-het-jaar.htm |archivedate=24 July 2011 |df= }}</ref>
====2010–11 season==== [[File:Suarez Ajax captain.jpg|thumb|Suárez playing for Ajax in a [[UEFA Champions League]] match against [[FC Dynamo Kyiv|Dynamo Kyiv]] in 2010]]
Soon after Suárez returned from his World Cup campaign, he scored his 100th goal for Ajax in a 1–1 home draw against [[PAOK FC|PAOK]] in a [[2010–11 UEFA Champions League#Third qualifying round|UEFA Champions League qualifier]].<ref name="Liverpool profile"/><ref name="Ajax100">{{cite web|url=http://www.vi.nl/Nieuws-item/184459/Suarez-veertiende-Ajacied-met-minimaal-honderd-goals.htm |title=Suarez veertiende Ajacied met minimaal honderd goals |publisher=Voetbal International |date=28 July 2010 |accessdate=6 August 2010 |language=Dutch |trans-title=Suarez Ajax's fourteenth player with at least one hundred goals |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100731085836/http://www.vi.nl/Nieuws-item/184459/Suarez-veertiende-Ajacied-met-minimaal-honderd-goals.htm |archivedate=31 July 2010 }}</ref> This put him in an elite group of players, including [[Johan Cruyff]], Marco van Basten and [[Dennis Bergkamp]], to score 100 or more goals with the club.<ref name="Echo 2-3"/><ref name="Ajax100"/> Suárez continued his scoring run with a hat-trick against [[De Graafschap]] in a 5–0 win.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.ajax.nl/News/Archive/Article/Suarez-hat-trick-helps-Ajax-win.htm |title=Suarez' hat trick helps Ajax win |work=Ajax.nl |publisher=AFC Ajax |date=29 August 2010 |accessdate=25 August 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120407013145/http://english.ajax.nl/News/Archive/Article/Suarez-hat-trick-helps-Ajax-win.htm |archivedate=7 April 2012 |df= }}</ref>
=====First biting incident===== On 20 November 2010, Suárez bit [[PSV Eindhoven|PSV]]'s [[Otman Bakkal]] on the shoulder during a 0–0 draw. Ajax suspended him for two matches and fined him an undisclosed amount, which the club said they would donate to a "good cause".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.ajax.nl/News/Archive/Article/Ajax-accepts-Suarez-suspension.htm |title=Ajax accepts Suarez' suspension |work=Ajax.nl |publisher=AFC Ajax |date=24 November 2010 |accessdate=25 August 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120407013208/http://english.ajax.nl/News/Archive/Article/Ajax-accepts-Suarez-suspension.htm |archivedate= 7 April 2012 |df= }}</ref> The Dutch daily newspaper ''[[De Telegraaf]]'' branded Suárez the "Cannibal of Ajax".<ref name="Cannibal of Ajax"/><ref name="Echo 2-3"/> The KNVB increased Suárez's suspension to seven league matches.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.fifa.com/worldfootball/clubfootball/news/newsid=1340434.html |title=Suarez banned for seven games |agency= Press Association |work=FIFA.com |date=24 November 2010 |accessdate=2 February 2011}}</ref> Suárez apologised for his actions through a video he uploaded to his [[Facebook]] page.<ref name="Echo 2-3"/>
=====Transfer to Liverpool===== During the suspension, Ajax were in contact with other European clubs interested in Suárez. On 28 January 2011, they accepted a €26.5 million ([[Pound sterling|£]]22.8 million) offer for Suárez from [[Premier League]] club [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]].<ref name="Echo 2-4"/><ref name="BBCLiverpool">{{cite news |url= http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/l/liverpool/9377256.stm |title=Liverpool land Luis Suarez in £22.7m deal with Ajax |work=BBC Sport |date=31 January 2011 |accessdate=2 February 2011}}</ref> Despite leaving while suspended, Suárez departed Ajax on good terms, and he was given a farewell sendoff after an Ajax match. During the sendoff, an Ajax coach spoke to him and the crowd and said how the club wished he could stay longer; the crowd applauded their agreement and fireworks followed.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.ajax.nl/News/Archive/Article/Jubilant-farewell-Suarez.htm |title=Jubilant farewell Suarez |work=Ajax.nl |publisher=AFC Ajax |date=21 February 2011 |accessdate=26 August 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110224224341/http://english.ajax.nl/News/Archive/Article/Jubilant-farewell-Suarez.htm |archivedate=24 February 2011 |df= }}</ref> Ajax ended the [[2010–11 Eredivisie|2010–11 season]] as Eredivisie champions<ref>{{cite web |url= http://soccernet.espn.go.com/tables/_/league/ned.1/season/2010/dutch-eredivisie |title= 2010/11 Dutch Eredivisie Table / Standings |publisher= ESPN Soccernet |year= 2011 |accessdate=27 August 2011}}</ref> and Suárez was given a winner's medal<ref name="football database"/><ref>{{cite news |url= https://www.theguardian.com/football/2011/jun/01/the-knowledge-football-religious-groups |title= Football teams for religion |first= Barry |last=Glendenning |work= guardian.co.uk |date= 1 June 2011 |accessdate=27 August 2011}}</ref> for his 7 goals in 13 appearances.<ref name="Voetbal">{{cite web|url=http://www.vi.nl/Spelers/Speler/Luis-Surez.htm |title=Luis Suárez Statistics |accessdate=13 April 2010 |publisher=Voetbal International |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100325124025/http://www.vi.nl/Spelers/Speler/Luis-Surez.htm |archivedate=25 March 2010 }}</ref> While he was at Ajax, Suárez scored 111 goals in 159 appearances.<ref name="Ajax departure summary"/><ref name="Echo 2-4"/>
===Liverpool=== ====2010–11 season==== [[File:Suarez and Carroll crop.jpg|thumb|Suárez (left) was signed by Liverpool on the same day as [[Andy Carroll]]]] On 31 January 2011, Suárez signed a five-and-a-half-year deal with Liverpool until 2016,<ref name="Echo 2-4"/><ref>{{cite news |first=Elliot |last=Ball |url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,11661_6715190,00.html |title=Suarez seals Reds switch |publisher=Sky Sports |date=31 January 2011 |accessdate=31 January 2011}}</ref> and was the club's most expensive signing (£22.8 million) until the arrival of [[Andy Carroll]] (£35 million) a few hours later.<ref name="Stoke debut">{{cite news |url= http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/liverpool-fc/liverpool-fc-news/2011/02/02/luis-suarez-nets-on-liverpool-fc-debut-100252-28106136/ |title= Luis Suarez nets on Liverpool FC debut |work= Liverpool Echo |publisher=Trinity Mirror |date=2 February 2011 |accessdate=27 August 2011}}</ref> Suárez requested the number seven shirt, but at the time did not realise that it had been worn by Liverpool legends such as his new manager [[Kenny Dalglish]] and [[Kevin Keegan]].<ref>{{cite news |url= http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/liverpool-fc/liverpool-fc-news/2011/01/31/liverpool-fc-hand-luis-suarez-anfield-s-famous-no7-shirt-100252-28087283/ |title= Liverpool FC hand Luis Suarez Anfield's famous No7 shirt |first= Neil |last=Jones |work= Liverpool Echo |date= 31 January 2011 |accessdate=26 August 2011}}</ref> Suárez made his Liverpool debut on 2 February against [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]] at [[Anfield]] in a 2–0 win; he came on as a substitute and scored Liverpool's second goal in front of the [[Spion Kop (stadiums)|Kop]] in the 79th minute.<ref name="Stoke debut"/><ref>{{cite news |first=Mandeep |last=Sanghera |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/9378729.stm |title=Liverpool 2–0 Stoke |publisher=BBC Sport |date=2 February 2011 |accessdate=2 February 2011}}</ref> He was one of Liverpool's best players during his partial season<ref name="Hytner">{{cite news |url= https://www.theguardian.com/football/2011/may/09/fulham-liverpool-premier-league |title= Luis Suárez steals the show as Liverpool thrash Fulham |last= Hytner |first=David |work=The Guardian |location=London |date= 10 May 2011 |accessdate=28 August 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url= http://www.liverpooldailypost.co.uk/liverpool-fc/liverpool-fc-news/2011/08/11/liverpool-fc-season-preview-2011-12-lfc-start-to-bridge-the-gap-on-their-rivals-at-the-top-of-the-premier-league-92534-29216966/2/ |title= Liverpool FC season preview 2011/12 – LFC start to bridge the gap on their rivals at the top of the Premier League |last=Doyle |first=Ian |work=Liverpool Daily Post |publisher=Trinity Mirror |page=2 |date= 11 August 2011 |accessdate=28 August 2011}}</ref><ref name="Times of India">{{cite news |url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/football/epl/epl-news/Uruguay-striker-Suarez-inspiring-Liverpool-revival/articleshow/9679210.cms|title= Uruguay striker Suarez inspiring Liverpool revival |agency= Associated Press |work= The Times of India |date= 21 August 2011 |accessdate=28 August 2011 }}{{dead link|date=June 2014}}</ref> and helped Liverpool go from 12th in the league in mid-January<ref name="Hytner"/> to finish sixth.<ref name="Times of India"/> He finished the [[2010–11 Premier League|2010–11 season]] with four goals in 13 games.<ref name="Voetbal"/>
====2011–12 season==== After winning the Player of the Tournament at the [[2011 Copa América]],<ref name="CopaAmerica"/> Suárez had a disappointing [[2011–12 Premier League|2011–12]] season by his standards.<ref name="Pearce2011-12">{{cite news |url= http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/liverpool-fc/lfc-player-profiles/luis-suarez/2012/05/19/james-pearce-s-review-of-liverpool-fc-s-2011-12-season-100252-31000189/3/ |title= James Pearce's review of Liverpool FC's 2011/12 season |last= Pearce |first= James |newspaper= Liverpool Echo |page=3 |date= 19 May 2012 |accessdate= 26 June 2012}}</ref> Liverpool finished in eighth place and Suárez scored 11 league goals.<ref name="Pearce2011-12"/> On 26 February, Liverpool won the [[2011–12 Football League Cup|League Cup]], defeating [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] in penalty shootout.<ref name="Bevan">{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17093419 |title= Cardiff 2–2 Liverpool |work=BBC Sport |date=26 February 2012 |accessdate= 26 June 2012 |first= Chris |last=Bevan}}</ref> On 28 April, Suárez scored his first Liverpool [[List of Premier League hat-tricks|hat-trick]] in 3–0 win against [[Norwich City F.C|Norwich City]] at [[Carrow Road]].<ref>{{cite news |url= https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17796316 |title=Norwich 0 Liverpool 3 |first= Arindam |last=Rej |work=BBC Sport |date=28 April 2012 |accessdate= 26 June 2012}}</ref> He finished sixth for the [[2011 FIFA Ballon d'Or]].<ref name="votingresults">{{cite web |url=https://www.fifa.com/mm/document/classic/awards/01/56/60/64/voting_results_ok.pdf |title=FIFA Ballon d'Or 2011 – voting results |work=FIFA.com |date= 9 January 2012 |accessdate=10 January 2012}}</ref>
====Racial abuse incident==== The season was marked by an incident in which Suárez was found guilty by a three-man panel from [[The Football Association]] (FA) of racially abusing [[Patrice Evra]] during a match against [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] in October; he was issued an eight-match suspension and a £40,000 fine.<ref name="racialguilt">{{cite news|url= http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/16186556.stm |title=Liverpool striker Luis Suarez handed eight-match FA ban |work=BBC Sport |date=20 December 2011 |accessdate=20 December 2011}}</ref> Suárez disputed this decision.<ref name="Suarez statement">{{cite news|last=Suárez |first=Luis |url=http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/latest-news/statement-from-luis-suarez |title=Statement from Luis Suarez |publisher=Liverpool FC Official Website |date=3 January 2012 |accessdate=25 June 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150219135306/http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/latest-news/statement-from-luis-suarez |archivedate=19 February 2015 |df= }}</ref>
After a 1–1 draw against Manchester United on 15 October 2011, Suárez was accused of racially abusing Evra,<ref name="FA Evra">{{cite news |url= http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/15324927.stm |title= The FA will look into claims Luis Suárez racially abused Patrice Evra |publisher=BBC Sport|date= 16 October 2011 |accessdate=16 October 2011}}</ref> and the FA opened up an investigation into the incident.<ref name="FA Evra"/> Suárez wrote on his [[Twitter]] and Facebook pages that he was upset by the accusation and denied the claims.<ref>{{cite news |url= http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/15328769.stm |title= Liverpool's Luis Suárez 'upset' by Patrice Evra's racism claim |publisher=BBC Sport|date=16 October 2011 |accessdate=16 October 2011}}</ref> On 16 November, the FA announced it would charge Suárez with "abusive and/or insulting words and/or behaviour contrary to FA rules", including "a reference to the ethnic origin and/or colour and/or race of Patrice Evra". Liverpool later released a statement announcing Suárez would plead innocent, adding they would "remain fully supportive" of him.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2011/nov/16/luis-suarez-liverpool-fa-racism |title=Liverpool's Luis Suárez will plead not guilty to FA racism charge |work=The Guardian |location=London |date=16 November 2011 |first=Daniel |last=Taylor |accessdate=17 November 2011}}</ref> On 20 December, the FA concluded a seven-day hearing, handing Suárez an eight-match ban and a £40,000 fine for racially abusing Evra.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/16186556.stm|title=Liverpool striker Luis Suarez handed eight-match FA ban |work=BBC Sport |date=20 December 2011 |accessdate=20 December 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Sir Alex Ferguson feels ban for Luis Suarez was right |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/16325493.stm |work=BBC Sport |accessdate=1 January 2012|date=24 December 2011}}</ref><ref name="RaceGuard">{{cite news |last=Williams |first=Richard |title=Liverpool should take heed of the past and accept Luis Suárez verdict |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2011/dec/21/luis-suarez-liverpool-racism-fight |publisher=Guardian News and Media |work=The Guardian |accessdate=1 January 2012|date=21 December 2011}}</ref>
In their next meeting in February, during the pregame handshakes, Suárez avoided shaking Evra's hand, for which Suárez and Dalglish were later forced to apologise.<ref>{{cite news |url= https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17004667 |work=BBC Sport |title= Luis Suarez and Kenny Dalglish apologise after US owners intervene over handshake row |last= Roan |first= Dan |date=12 February 2012 |accessdate= 12 February 2012}}</ref> Suárez was also banned for one match for [[Finger (gesture)|making an obscene gesture]] towards [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] fans.<ref>{{cite news |title=Luis Suarez admits misconduct charge after gesture|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/16148570 |work=[[BBC Sport]] |accessdate=25 June 2014 |date=28 December 2011}}</ref>
====2012–13 season==== On 7 August 2012, Suárez signed a new long-term contract with Liverpool.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/latest-news/suarez-signs-new-contract |publisher=Liverpool official website |title=Suarez signs new contract |date=7 August 2012 |accessdate=7 August 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120810020201/http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/latest-news/suarez-signs-new-contract |archivedate=10 August 2012 |df= }}</ref> On 26 August, he scored his first goal of the [[2012–13 Liverpool F.C. season|2012–13 season]] in a 2–2 draw with champions [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] at Anfield.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19310450|title=Liverpool 2 2 Man City |date=26 August 2012 |accessdate=8 August 2013 |work=BBC}}</ref> On 29 September 2012, Suárez scored a hat-trick in Liverpool's Premier League fixture away at [[Norwich City F.C|Norwich City]] for the second consecutive season.<ref>{{cite web |title=Norwich 2 – 5 Liverpool |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19684133|work=BBC Sport |publisher=BBC |accessdate=29 September 2012 |date=29 September 2012}}</ref>
[[File:Luis Suarez vs Arsenal (cropped).jpg|thumb|left|upright|Suárez playing for Liverpool against [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] in January 2013]] On 6 January 2013, Suárez handled the ball before scoring the decisive goal in Liverpool's 2–1 win over [[Mansfield Town F.C.|Mansfield Town]] from the [[Conference National]] in an [[2012–13 FA Cup|FA Cup]] third round match. Liverpool's manager [[Brendan Rodgers]] defended his player by claiming "it's not his job to own up", while Mansfield manager [[Paul Cox (footballer)|Paul Cox]] said he felt "a little bit gutted" by the "instinctive" handball, but admitted he would have accepted a goal scored like that by one of his players.<ref>{{cite news |title=Luis Suárez: 'It's not his job to own up' says Brendan Rodgers |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/jan/06/liverpool-brendan-rodgers-luis-suarez-mansfield |work=[[The Guardian]] |accessdate=19 January 2013 |first=Daniel |last=Taylor |date=6 January 2013}}</ref>
On 19 January, Suárez scored his seventh goal in three matches against Norwich, as Liverpool cruised to a 5–0 home league victory.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/news/story/_/id/1305262/luis-suarez-extends-reign-in-liverpool-reds'-rout-of-norwich |title=Luis Suarez fuel Liverpool's 5–0 romp |publisher=ESPNFC |date=19 January 2013 }}</ref> The following week, Suárez captained Liverpool for the first time for the FA Cup fourth round match against [[Oldham Athletic A.F.C.|Oldham Athletic]]; Liverpool lost 2–3.<ref>{{cite web|title=Liverpool FC Match Centre – Oldham v Liverpool |url=http://www.liverpoolfc.com/match/last-match/match-centre |publisher=[[Liverpool F.C.]] |accessdate=29 January 2013 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6E25xqAX7?url=http://www.liverpoolfc.com/match/last-match/match-centre |archivedate=29 January 2013 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy }}</ref> On 2 March, Suárez scored a hat-trick against [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]], leading Liverpool to a dominant 4–0 victory at the [[DW Stadium]]. In so doing, he became only the third Liverpool player to score 20 Premier League goals in a single season after [[Robbie Fowler]] and [[Fernando Torres]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21556751 |title= Wigan 0 Liverpool 4:Luis Suarez scored a hat-trick as Liverpool thrashed Wigan and boosted their hopes of European qualification.|work=BBC Sport |date=3 March 2013 |accessdate=3 March 2013}}</ref> On 10 March, Suárez scored his 50th goal in all competitions since joining ''the Reds'' by scoring the opener in a 3–2 home victory over [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]], ending Spurs' 12-match unbeaten run. He was also named man of the match for his performance after he won the decisive penalty which [[Steven Gerrard]] converted.
At the end of the season, Suárez was one of six players named on the shortlist for [[PFA Players' Player of the Year]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/news-and-comment/gordon-taylor-assesses-the-pfa-player-of-the-year-nominees-8580302.html |title=Gordon Taylor assesses The PFA Player of the Year nominees |date=19 April 2013|accessdate=8 August 2013 |work=The Independent |first=Simon |last=Stone}}</ref> Suárez finished second in the final ballot behind [[Gareth Bale]] of Tottenham<ref name="pfa">{{cite news |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11669/8679420/luis-suarezs-name-booed-twice-at-pfa-player-of-the-year-awards |title=Luis Suarez's name booed twice at PFA Player of the Year awards |date=29 April 2013 |accessdate=8 August 2013 |work=BSkyB}}</ref> and was named in the [[PFA Team of the Year]].<ref name="pfa"/> He was second-[[2012–13 Premier League#Top scorers|top goalscorer]] in the Premier League for [[2012–13 Premier League|2012–13]] with 23 goals and Liverpool's top scorer in all competitions with 30 goals.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/2013-07-22/liverpool-manager-rodgers-says-he-s-relaxed-about-suarez-future.html |title=Liverpool Manager Rodgers Says He's Relaxed About Suarez Future |date=22 July 2013 |accessdate=8 August 2013|work=Bloomberg}}</ref> On 28 May 2013, he was named as Liverpool's player of the season after receiving 64% of votes in a poll of the club's supporters.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/latest-news/your-player-of-the-season-revealed |title=Your player of the season revealed |date=28 May 2013 |accessdate=8 August 2013 |work=Liverpool Football Club |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130605215636/http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/latest-news/your-player-of-the-season-revealed |archivedate=5 June 2013 |df= }}</ref> [[File:Luis Suarez free kick v Zenit.jpg|thumb|Suárez about to score a 35-yard free kick against [[FC Zenit Saint Petersburg|Zenit Saint Petersburg]], his second goal in a 3–1 win, March 2013]]
=====Second biting incident===== On 21 April 2013, during a 2–2 draw with [[Chelsea F.C|Chelsea]] in a Premier League match at Anfield, Suárez bit [[Branislav Ivanović]]; this was the second time Suárez had bitten an opponent. It was not noticed by the officials, and Suárez scored an equaliser in injury time.<ref name="BranBite"/> The bite prompted [[Prime Minister of the United Kingdom|UK Prime Minister]] [[David Cameron]] to call on the FA to take a hard line with Suárez: the FA charged him with violent conduct and he was fined an undisclosed sum by his club.<ref name="Cameron"/> Contrary to claims from Suárez, Ivanović did not accept an apology.<ref name="Cameron">{{cite news |title=David Cameron calls on FA to take hard line with Luis Suárez over bite |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/apr/22/luis-suarez-charged-biting-ivanovic |work=[[The Guardian]] |accessdate=7 June 2013 |first=Andy |last=Hunter |date=22 April 2013}}</ref> Suárez accepted the violent conduct charge but denied the FA's claim the standard punishment of three matches was clearly insufficient for his offence.<ref>{{cite news |last=Hunter |first=Andy |title=Luis Suárez says three-match ban is enough for biting Branislav Ivanovic |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/apr/23/luis-suarez-liverpool-fa-bite |work=[[The Guardian]] |accessdate=7 June 2013 |date=23 April 2013}}</ref> A three-man independent panel appointed by the FA decided on a ten-game ban for Suárez, who did not appeal the ban; the panel criticised Suárez for not appreciating "the seriousness" of the incident when he argued against a long ban. The panel also wanted to send a "strong message that such deplorable behaviours do not have a place in football", while noting that "all players in the higher level of the game are seen as role models, have the duty to act professionally and responsibly, and set the highest example of good conduct to the rest of the game – especially to young players".<ref>{{cite web |title=Luis Suarez: Panel criticises Liverpool striker's reaction |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/22311782 |work=[[BBC Sport]] |accessdate=7 June 2013}}</ref>
On 31 May 2013, Suárez said he would be seeking an exit from Liverpool in the summer, citing excessive media attention on his family as a reason for wanting to leave.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/liverpool/10091490/Luis-Suarez-I-want-to-leave-Liverpool.html |title=Luis Suarez: I want to leave Liverpool |newspaper=Daily Telegraph |date=31 May 2013 |accessdate=31 August 2014}}</ref> On 6 August, after Liverpool had rejected a bid of [[Pounds sterling|£]]40,000,001 for the player from Arsenal, Suárez reiterated his wish to leave Liverpool and said Liverpool had previously promised to allow him a transfer if the club failed to qualify for the [[2013–14 UEFA Champions League]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/aug/06/luis-suarez-liverpool-arsenal-transfer |title=Luis Suárez: Let me leave, Liverpool – just like you promised |date=6 August 2013 |work=The Guardian}}</ref> The following day, Liverpool manager Brendan Rodgers said Liverpool had not broken any promises to Suárez and that the player had shown "total disrespect" for the club.<ref name="alone">{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23610289 |title=Luis Suarez: Brendan Rodgers tells Liverpool striker to train alone |date=7 August 2013 |work=BBC Sport}}</ref> After this incident, the British press reported that Suárez had been instructed to train away from the Liverpool first-team squad by Rodgers.<ref name="alone"/><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/aug/07/luis-suarez-liverpool-outcast |title=Outcast Luis Suárez is told to train away from Liverpool squad |date=8 August 2013 |work=The Guardian}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.sky.com/story/1125965/suarez-forced-to-train-alone |title=Suarez Forced To Train Alone |date=8 August 2013 |work=BSkyB}}</ref> On 8 August, Liverpool owner [[John W. Henry]] stated that Suárez would not be allowed to leave the club.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23627573 |title=Luis Suarez: Liverpool owner John W Henry says striker not for sale |date=8 August 2013 |work=BBC Sport}}</ref>
====2013–14 season, Player of the Year==== On 14 August, Suárez appeared to reverse his position about wanting to leave the club, with reports stating he wanted to stay at the club and that he was possibly going to sign a contract extension, citing the support from Liverpool supporters as the reason for his unexpected turnaround.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/transfers/transfer-news-luis-suarez-deals-a-blow-to-arsenal-after-surprise-uturn-in-bid-to-remain-with-liverpool-8760742.html |title=Transfer news: Arsenal hopes reignited after Luis Suarez denies saying he wants to stay at Liverpool |work=The Independent |location=London |date=14 August 2013 |accessdate=17 January 2014 |first1=Simon |last1=Rice |first2=Jack |last2=de Menezes}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/aug/14/luis-suarez-liverpool |title=Luis Suárez says he will stay at Liverpool |work=The Guardian |date= |accessdate=17 January 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/liverpool/10241822/Luis-Suarez-staying-at-Liverpool-with-reports-in-Uruguay-claiming-he-will-sign-new-deal-at-Anfield.html |title=Luis Suarez 'staying' at Liverpool with reports in Uruguay claiming he will sign new deal at Anfield |work=The Daily Telegraph |date= 14 August 2013 |accessdate=17 January 2014}}</ref> Suárez returned to first-team training two days later after "offer[ing] contrition" to his teammates but reportedly not apologising to his manager.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/aug/16/luis-suarez-liverpool-apology-training |title=Luis Suárez resumes Liverpool training but offers Rodgers no apology |first=Andy |last=Hunter |work=The Guardian |date=16 August 2013 |accessdate=13 May 2014}}</ref>
On 25 September, Suárez returned to the Liverpool team after his suspension to make his first appearance of the [[2013–14 Liverpool F.C. season|2013–14 season]] in a [[2013–14 Football League Cup|League Cup]] third round tie against Manchester United at [[Old Trafford]], losing 1–0.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/latest-news/145766-reds-suffer-cup-exit-on-suarez-s-return|title=Reds suffer cup exit on Suarez's return |date=25 September 2013 |accessdate=5 October 2013|work=Liverpool FC}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/24140621 |title=Manchester United 1 0 Liverpool |accessdate=5 October 2013|date=25 September 2013 |work=BBC Sport}}</ref> On 29 September, Suárez made his first [[2013–14 Premier League|Premier League]] appearance of the season, scoring twice as Liverpool defeated [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] 3–1 at the [[Stadium of Light]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/latest-news/146001-suarez-and-sturridge-down-sunderland |title=Suarez and Sturridge down Sunderland |date=29 September 2013 |accessdate=5 October 2013|work=Liverpool FC}}</ref> On 5 October, Suárez made his first appearance of the season at Anfield, where he scored Liverpool's opening goal in a 3–1 win against [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/oct/05/liverpool-crystal-palace-premier-league |title=Liverpool's Luis Suárez and Daniel Sturridge put Crystal Palace to sword |date=6 October 2013 |work=The Guardian}}</ref> On 26 October, he scored his fourth Premier League hat-trick, his first at Anfield, in a 4–1 defeat of [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]]. According to the [[BBC]], he has [[List of Premier League hat-tricks|scored a hat-trick]] every 20.3 Premier League matches, "the best rate of all 46 players to have scored more than one treble" in the top tier.<ref name="BBC">{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/24591245 |title=Liverpool – West Brom |work=BBC Sport |accessdate=26 October 2013}}</ref>
{{Quote box|width=27%|align=right|quote="He [Suárez] has shown in his time at Liverpool in the last year or so that he is near unplayable. He on his own can occupy a back four with his movement and his cleverness."|source=— [[Brendan Rodgers]], Liverpool manager, in a season when Suárez was player of the year.<ref>[http://www.espn.co.uk/football/sport/story/273287.html "Suarez near unplayable – Rodgers"]. ESPN. Retrieved 20 May 2014</ref>}}
On 4 December, Suárez scored four goals against Norwich City in a 5–1 home win.<ref>{{cite web|title=Suarez hits four in Liverpool win|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/25115744|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=4 December 2013|date=4 December 2013}}</ref> He became the first player in Premier League history to score three hat-tricks against the same club, and took his scoring record against Norwich to 11 goals in 5 matches.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/301797/report|title=Premier League: Luis Suarez scores four goals as Liverpool beat Norwich 5–1 |date=4 December 2013 |work=BSkyB}}</ref> On 15 December, Suárez captained Liverpool for the first time in a Premier League match against Tottenham Hotspur.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.fifa.com/world-match-centre/news/newsid/224/674/6/index.html|title=Suarez: The team is the captain |date=16 December 2013 |work=FIFA}}</ref> He scored twice and assisted once as the team recorded a 5–0 win at [[White Hart Lane]] to close the gap on league leaders Arsenal to two points.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/25287554|title=Tottenham 0 5 Liverpool |date=15 December 2013 |work=BBC Sport}}</ref> The following day, Suárez was named the [[Football Supporters' Federation|Football Supporters' Federation Player of the Year]] for 2013.<ref>{{cite web|title=WINNERS: FSF Awards in association with William Hill|url=http://fsf.org.uk/latest-news/view/WINNERS-FSF-Awards-in-association-with-William-Hill|publisher=FSF.org.uk |accessdate=18 July 2015|date=17 December 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news of FSF Player of the Year award |date=16 December 2013 |work=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |first=Henry |last=Winter}}</ref> On 20 December, Suárez signed a new four-and-a-half-year contract with Liverpool.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/latest-news/151639-luis-suarez-signs-new-contract-at-lfc |title=Luis Suarez signs new contract at LFC |date=20 December 2013 |accessdate=20 December 2013 |publisher=Liverpool F.C.}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Luis Suarez signs new long-term Liverpool deal |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/25463249 |work=BBC Sport |accessdate=20 December 2013 |date=20 December 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/dec/20/luis-suarez-signs-long-term-liverpool-deal |title=Luis Suárez signs long-term deal to stay at Liverpool until 2018 |date=20 December 2013 |accessdate=26 December 2013 |work=The Guardian |location=London}}</ref>
On 1 January 2014, by scoring in a 2–0 home win over [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]], Suárez became the first Liverpool player to score 20 or more goals in successive Premier League seasons since Robbie Fowler in [[1994–95 Liverpool F.C. season|1994–95]] and [[1995–96 Liverpool F.C. season|1995–96]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/25513270 |title=Liverpool 2 0 Hull |date=1 January 2014 |work=BBC Sport}}</ref> He equalled [[Andy Cole]]'s Premier League record for the earliest date to reach the 20-goal mark, but set a new record low of 15 matches.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/liverpool-2-hull-city-0-luis-suarez-hits-recordequalling-goal-to-help-brendan-rodgers-reds-past-the-tigers-9032801.html |title=Liverpool 2 Hull City 0: Luis Suarez hits record-equalling goal to help Brendan Rodgers' Reds past the Tigers |work=Evening Standard |location=London |date=1 January 2013 |accessdate=13 May 2014}}</ref> His strike partnership this season with [[Daniel Sturridge]] has earned them a nickname "SAS", ''i.e.'', ''Sturridge and Suárez".<ref>{{cite news|last1=Watson|first1=Jack|title="I'm One of the Best Players in the World" – Liverpool's £22m Superstar States|url=http://www.squawka.com/news/im-one-of-the-best-players-in-the-world-liverpools-22m-superstar-argues/79534|accessdate=1 July 2017|work=Squawka Football News|date=7 March 2014|language=en}}</ref>
On 1 March, Suárez made his 100th Premier League appearance, scoring in a 3–0 win over [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] at [[St Mary's Stadium]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/southampton-0-liverpool-3-match-report-luis-suarez-and-raheem-sterling-on-target-as-liverpool-soar-into-title-reckoning-9162524.html |location=London |first=Nick |last=Szczepanik}}</ref> In the following fixture, he scored his 25th league goal of the season as Liverpool defeated Manchester United at Old Trafford for the first time since 2009 by a convincing three-goal margin.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/manchester-united/10701050/Manchester-United-0-Liverpool-3-match-report.html |title=Manchester United 0 Liverpool 3: match report |date=16 March 2014 |accessdate=24 March 2014 |work=The Telegraph |location=London |first=Henry |last=Winter}}</ref> On 22 March, Suárez scored his sixth [[List of Premier League hat-tricks|Premier League hat-trick]], and third of the season, in a 6–3 win over [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] at the [[Cardiff City Stadium]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/sport/story/293689.html|title=Suarez hat-trick continues title assault|date=22 March 2014|work=ESPN}}</ref> On 30 March, he broke Robbie Fowler's club record of 28 goals in a Premier League season in a 4–0 home win against Tottenham which took Liverpool top of the league with six matches remaining.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/sport/story/295819.html |title=Suarez into the record books as Liverpool go top |date=30 March 2014 |work=ESPN}}</ref> On 20 April, he scored in a 3–2 win at Norwich to become the first Liverpool player to score 30 league goals in a season since [[Ian Rush]] in [[1986–87 Liverpool F.C. season|1986–87]].<ref>{{cite news
